Key Match Events: Jonatan Clase hit his first career home run in the seventh inning.
Post-Match Reflections: The Blue Jays won for the first time in six games and avoided a three-game sweep.
Boston needed to win their final four games and get help from opponents in the American League wild-card race but failed to do so.
Boston has missed the playoffs in three straight seasons, the first time that's happened since 2010-2012.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Clase went 3 for 3 with a walk, scored twice and drove in two.
Alejandro Kirk, who extended his career-best hitting streak to 17 games, had three hits and three RBIs.
Kevin Gausman pitched six innings to match his career high in wins and allowed one run and four hits.
Vladimir Guerrero Jr. finished 2 for 4 and has 197 hits this season.
